content: is completed and then the sleeves are finished one at a time this pattern contains two different neckline options the funnel neck or the folded collar and two neck shaping options german short row shaping or no neck shaping these options can be combined in any way to achieve your perfect fit the german short row neck shaping is a little bit more difficult and so is most suitable for knitters with some experience or adventurous beginners a note on stripes this sweater can be knitted with or without stripes the stripes in the sample are 6 row wide and each separated by 14 row in the main colour in order to avoid a jog in the stripe when knitting in the round a small trick can be used after knitting the first round with a new colour lift the stitch below the first stitch of the next round onto the left needle knit it together with the first stitch of the next round and then continue this technique can be seen in the video or by searching for videos demonstrating jogless stripes by knitting into the stitch below on the sample the first stripe begins around 8cm below the collar a note on german short row this pattern includes optional short row shaping for the neckline this is not essential but will improve the fit at the front of the neck slightly without dramatically impacting the overall look in order to do the turns without leaving holes in the fabric do the following when turning from the right side to the wrong side turn the work slip one stitch purlwise with the yarn held in front and then wrap the yarn over the needle tightly and back between the needles to the front ready to purl the next stitch when turning from the wrong side to the right side turn the work and bring the yarn between the needles to the front as if you are going to purl then slip one stitch purlwise with the yarn held in front and wrap the yarn over the needle so it held in the back ready to knit the next stitch in each case you will be left with a strange-looking double stitch with two legs work this stitch like a single normal stitch when you come across it again you may well find it easier to look at the video tutorial for instructions on how to do this the german short row instructions are near the end of the video pattern begins here cast on 64 68 72 80 84 88 88 stitches on 4 5mm 40cm circular needles using the longtail cast on if you don t use this cast on make sure you are casting on loosely enough to get the collar over your head and check you can once you have knitted a few centimetres join in the round and place a bor marker to indicate the
